property.caption: Grid name
property.description: Name of the data grid widget.

property.caption: Grid Entity
property.description: The type of objects in the grid.

property.caption: Column name
property.description: (Optional) Name of the data grid column that will get a class. If blank, style will be applied to the row.

property.caption: Class to apply
property.description: The class to apply if the JS rule evaluates to true.

property.caption: Rule JavaScript
property.description: (Optional) This will be overridden if you select a nanoflow. JavaScript that returns true when you want the class applied. You have 2 objects available: rowObj and contextObj. (ex: Check to see if an attribute of the row matches one from the grid: 'return rowObj.get("attributeName") === contextObject.get("attributeName");' )

property.caption: Nanoflow
property.description: (Optional) A nanoflow that returns a boolean. If you don't use a nanoflow, you must define custom JavaScript instead.
